alert.note: Alert for Southern Hidalgo; Starr (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 27 at 7:51PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Hidalgo and central Starr Counties through 830 PM CDT... At 750 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles north of La Victoria, or 12 miles north of Garciasville, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rio Grande City, Roma, Sullivan City, Escobares, Los Ebanos, Garciasville, La Rosita, El Sauz, La Grulla, and La Victoria. This includes US Highway 83 between mile markers 800 and 842. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
